bug.short_desc: lot of selinux problems when starting docker
bug.cf_doc_type: If docs needed, set a value

long_desc.thetext:
$ rpm -q selinux-policy docker selinux-policy-3.13.1-202.fc25.noarch docker-1.11.2-12.git4ddbd3d.fc25.x86_64 # systemctl start docker
---- time->Sun Jul 17 18:04:32 2016 type=AVC msg=audit(1468771472.968:6738): avc: denied { unlink } for pid=5689 comm="docker" name="81c87c3546bd3e44dd78d5c051d446e0de7b33d9e85ac61f0bd0e8b7e72c237b.sock" dev="dm-1" ino=528202 scontext=system_u:system_r:docker_t:s0 tcontext=system_u:object_r:docker_var_lib_t:s0 tclass=sock_file permissive=1 ---- time->Sun Jul 17 18:04:33 2016 type=AVC msg=audit(1468771473.100:6740): avc: denied { execute } for pid=6162 comm="docker-storage-" name="lvm" dev="dm-1" ino=793649 scontext=system_u:system_r:docker_t:s0 tcontext=system_u:object_r:lvm_exec_t:s0 tclass=file permissive=1 ---- time->Sun Jul 17 18:04:33 2016 type=AVC msg=audit(1468771473.100:6741): avc: denied { read } for pid=6162 comm="docker-storage-" name="lvm" dev="dm-1" ino=793649 scontext=system_u:system_r:docker_t:s0 tcontext=system_u:object_r:lvm_exec_t:s0 tclass=file permissive=1 ---- time->Sun Jul 17 tcontext=system_u:object_r:lvm_exec_t:s0 tclass=file permissive=1 ---- time->Sun Jul 17 18:04:33 2016 type=AVC msg=audit(1468771473.101:6743): avc: denied { execute_no_trans } for pid=6163 comm="docker-storage-" path="/usr/sbin/lvm" dev="dm-1" ino=793649 scontext=system_u:system_r:docker_t:s0 tcontext=system_u:object_r:lvm_exec_t:s0 tclass=file permissive=1 ---- time->Sun Jul 17 18:04:33 2016 type=AVC msg=audit(1468771473.107:6744): avc: denied { connectto } for pid=6163 comm="lvs" path="/run/lvm/lvmetad.socket" scontext=system_u:system_r:docker_t:s0 tcontext=system_u:system_r:lvm_t:s0 tclass=unix_stream_socket permissive=1 ---- time->Sun Jul 17 18:04:33 2016 type=AVC msg=audit(1468771473.111:6745): avc: denied { read search } for pid=6163 comm="lvs" name="lvm" dev="tmpfs" ino=14676 scontext=system_u:system_r:docker_t:s0 tcontext=system_u:object_r:lvm_lock_t:s0 tclass=dir permissive=1 ---- time->Sun Jul 17 18:04:33 2016 type=AVC msg=audit(1468771473.112:6746): avc: denied { add_name } for pid=6163 comm="lvs" name="V_fedora_x1carbon:aux" scontext=system_u:system_r:docker_t:s0 tcontext=system_u:object_r:lvm_lock_t:s0 tclass=dir permissive=1 ---- time->Sun Jul 17 18:04:33 2016 type=AVC msg=audit(1468771473.112:6747): avc: denied { create } for pid=6163 comm="lvs" name="V_fedora_x1carbon:aux" scontext=system_u:system_r:docker_t:s0 tcontext=system_u:object_r:lvm_lock_t:s0 tclass=file permissive=1 ---- time->Sun Jul 17 18:04:33 2016 type=AVC msg=audit(1468771473.112:6748): avc: denied { read append open } for pid=6163 comm="lvs" path="/run/lock/lvm/V_fedora_x1carbon:aux" dev="tmpfs" ino=12029579 scontext=system_u:system_r:docker_t:s0 tcontext=system_u:object_r:lvm_lock_t:s0 tclass=file permissive=1 ---- time->Sun Jul 17 18:04:33 2016 type=AVC msg=audit(1468771473.113:6749): avc: denied { lock } for pid=6163 comm="lvs" path="/run/lock/lvm/V_fedora_x1carbon:aux" dev="tmpfs" ino=12029579 scontext=system_u:system_r:docker_t:s0 tcontext=system_u:object_r:lvm_lock_t:s0 tclass=file permissive=1 ---- time->Sun Jul 17 18:04:33 2016 type=AVC msg=audit(1468771473.113:6750): avc: denied { remove_name } for pid=6163 comm="lvs" name="V_fedora_x1carbon:aux" dev="tmpfs" ino=12029579 scontext=system_u:system_r:docker_t:s0 tcontext=system_u:object_r:lvm_lock_t:s0 tclass=dir permissive=1 ---- time->Sun Jul 17 18:04:33 2016 type=AVC msg=audit(1468771473.113:6751): avc: denied { unlink } for pid=6163 comm="lvs" name="V_fedora_x1carbon:aux" dev="tmpfs" ino=12029579 scontext=system_u:system_r:docker_t:s0 tcontext=system_u:object_r:lvm_lock_t:s0 tclass=file permissive=1 ---- time->Sun Jul 17 18:04:33 2016 type=AVC msg=audit(1468771473.161:6752): avc: denied { read } for pid=6169 comm="pvs" name="mmcblk0" dev="devtmpfs" ino=13325 scontext=system_u:system_r:docker_t:s0 tcontext=system_u:object_r:removable_device_t:s0 tclass=blk_file permissive=1 ---- time->Sun Jul 17 18:04:33 2016 type=AVC msg=audit(1468771473.161:6753): avc: denied { open } for pid=6169 comm="pvs" path="/dev/mmcblk0" dev="devtmpfs" ino=13325 scontext=system_u:system_r:docker_t:s0 tcontext=system_u:object_r:removable_device_t:s0 tclass=blk_file permissive=1 ---- time->Sun Jul 17 18:04:33 2016 type=AVC msg=audit(1468771473.161:6754): avc: denied { ioctl } for pid=6169 comm="pvs" path="/dev/mmcblk0" dev="devtmpfs" ino=13325 ioctlcmd=1272 scontext=system_u:system_r:docker_t:s0 tcontext=system_u:object_r:removable_device_t:s0 tclass=blk_file permissive=1 ---- time->Sun Jul 17 18:04:33 2016 type=AVC msg=audit(1468771473.235:6755): avc: denied { read } for pid=6182 comm="vgs" name="fedora_x1carbon" dev="dm-1" ino=1053719 scontext=system_u:system_r:docker_t:s0 tcontext=system_u:object_r:lvm_metadata_t:s0 tclass=file permissive=1 ---- time->Sun Jul 17 18:04:33 2016 type=AVC msg=audit(1468771473.235:6756): avc: denied { open } for pid=6182 comm="vgs" path="/etc/lvm/backup/fedora_x1carbon" dev="dm-1" ino=1053719 scontext=system_u:system_r:docker_t:s0 tcontext=system_u:object_r:lvm_metadata_t:s0 tclass=file permissive=1 ---- time->Sun Jul 17 18:04:33 2016 type=AVC msg=audit(1468771473.679:6766): avc: denied { create } for pid=6189 comm="docker" name="805619f55e21ddd807318bc5a07a447f1c81049746a9fc8863b3bf03f77af08e.sock" scontext=system_u:system_r:docker_t:s0 tcontext=system_u:object_r:docker_var_lib_t:s0 tclass=sock_file permissive=1 ---- time->Sun Jul 17 18:04:33 2016 type=AVC msg=audit(1468771473.680:6767): avc: denied { setattr } for pid=6189 comm="docker" name="805619f55e21ddd807318bc5a07a447f1c81049746a9fc8863b3bf03f77af08e.sock" dev="dm-1" ino=528202 scontext=system_u:system_r:docker_t:s0 tcontext=system_u:object_r:docker_var_lib_t:s0 tclass=sock_file permissive=1 ---- time->Sun Jul 17 18:04:33 2016 type=AVC msg=audit(1468771473.683:6768): avc: denied { read } for pid=6189 comm="docker" dev="nsfs" ino=4026531969 scontext=system_u:system_r:docker_t:s0 tcontext=system_u:object_r:nsfs_t:s0 tclass=file permissive=1 ---- time->Sun Jul 17 18:04:33 2016 type=AVC msg=audit(1468771473.683:6769): avc: denied { open } for pid=6189 comm="docker" path="net:[4026531969]" dev="nsfs" ino=4026531969 scontext=system_u:system_r:docker_t:s0 tcontext=system_u:object_r:nsfs_t:s0 tclass=file permissive=1

Most of these should be handled via the latest docker-selinux policy. We will be transitioning to lvm to handle the lvm calls. The nsfs calls will also be handled. THe sock_file under /var/lib/docker is curious though. I want to know what socket is listening there?
This bug appears to have been reported against 'rawhide' during the Fedora 25 development cycle. Changing version to '25'.

I'm seeing fairly similar issues on 'rawhide' while executing docker-storage-setup
selinux-policy-3.13.1-205.fc26.noarch docker-1.12.0-2.gitad4812e.fc26.x86_64
Aug 01 22:33:08 th0ultra.local audit[6695]: AVC avc: denied { connectto } for pid=6695 comm="lvs" path="/run/lvm/lvmetad.socket" scontext=system_u:system_r:docker_t:s0 tcontext=system_u:system_r:lvm_t:s0 tclass=unix_stream_socket permissive=1 Aug 01 22:33:08 th0ultra.local audit[1]: SERVICE_STOP pid=1 uid=0 auid=4294967295 ses=4294967295 subj=system_u:system_r:init_t:s0 msg='unit=docker-containerd comm="systemd" exe="/usr/lib/systemd/systemd" hostname=? addr=? terminal=? res=failed' Aug 01 22:33:08 th0ultra.local audit[6695]: AVC avc: denied { read search } for pid=6695 comm="lvs" name="lvm" dev="tmpfs" ino=2036 scontext=system_u:system_r:docker_t:s0 tcontext=system_u:object_r:lvm_lock_t:s0 tclass=dir permissive=1 Aug 01 22:33:08 th0ultra.local audit[6695]: AVC avc: denied { add_name } for pid=6695 comm="lvs" name="V_fedora_th0ultra:aux" scontext=system_u:system_r:docker_t:s0 tcontext=system_u:object_r:lvm_lock_t:s0 tclass=dir permissive=1 Aug 01 22:33:08 th0ultra.local audit[6695]: AVC avc: denied { create } for pid=6695 comm="lvs" name="V_fedora_th0ultra:aux" scontext=system_u:system_r:docker_t:s0 tcontext=system_u:object_r:lvm_lock_t:s0 tclass=file permissive=1 Aug 01 22:33:08 th0ultra.local audit[6695]: AVC avc: denied { read append open } for pid=6695 comm="lvs" path="/run/lock/lvm/V_fedora_th0ultra:aux" dev="tmpfs" ino=129731 scontext=system_u:system_r:docker_t:s0 tcontext=system_u:object_r:lvm_lock_t:s0 tclass=file permissive=1 Aug 01 22:33:08 th0ultra.local audit[6695]: AVC avc: denied { lock } for pid=6695 comm="lvs" path="/run/lock/lvm/V_fedora_th0ultra:aux" dev="tmpfs" ino=129731 scontext=system_u:system_r:docker_t:s0 tcontext=system_u:object_r:lvm_lock_t:s0 tclass=file permissive=1 Aug 01 22:33:08 th0ultra.local audit[6695]: AVC avc: denied { remove_name } for pid=6695 comm="lvs" name="V_fedora_th0ultra:aux" dev="tmpfs" ino=129731 scontext=system_u:system_r:docker_t:s0 tcontext=system_u:object_r:lvm_lock_t:s0 tclass=dir permissive=1 Aug 01 22:33:08 th0ultra.local audit[6695]: AVC avc: denied { unlink } for pid=6695 comm="lvs" name="V_fedora_th0ultra:aux" dev="tmpfs" ino=129731 scontext=system_u:system_r:docker_t:s0 tcontext=system_u:object_r:lvm_lock_t:s0 tclass=file permissive=1 Aug 01 22:33:08 th0ultra.local audit[6710]: AVC avc: denied { read } for pid=6710 comm="vgs" name="fedora_th0ultra" dev="dm-1" ino=1836882 scontext=system_u:system_r:docker_t:s0 tcontext=system_u:object_r:lvm_metadata_t:s0 tclass=file permissive=1 Aug 01 22:33:08 th0ultra.local audit[6710]: AVC avc: denied { open } for pid=6710 comm="vgs" path="/etc/lvm/backup/fedora_th0ultra" dev="dm-1" ino=1836882 scontext=system_u:system_r:docker_t:s0 tcontext=system_u:object_r:lvm_metadata_t:s0 tclass=file permissive=1 Aug 01 22:33:08 th0ultra.local audit[1]: SERVICE_START pid=1 uid=0 auid=4294967295 ses=4294967295 subj=system_u:system_r:init_t:s0 msg='unit=docker-storage-setup comm="systemd" exe="/usr/lib/systemd/systemd" hostname=? addr=? terminal=? res=failed'
Lokesh could you update docker-1.12 in F25? We have it in Rawhide. Would rather only support 1 version at this point.
Antonio ship docker-1.12 into f25 please.

(In reply to Daniel Walsh from comment #5) > Antonio ship docker-1.12 into f25 please.
Done - F25 and Rawhide now have docker 1.12.1
Dan, does this fix this BZ?
Yes this issue should be fixed now.
